revision.comment: /* External links */ added links to 10gen education and MongoDB Monitoring and Backup Service (referenced above in article under products & services)
revision.text:
{{Infobox company | name = 10gen (the MongoDB company) | company_logo = [[File:10gen Logo.png|225 px]] | type = Private | founded = [[2007]] | founder = {{plainlist| *[[Kevin P. Ryan]] *[[Dwight Merriman]] (Chairman) *[[Eliot Horowitz]] (CTO) }} | key_people = {{plainlist| *[[Max Schireson]] (CEO) *[[Dwight Merriman]] (Chairman) *[[Eliot Horowitz]] (CTO) *[[Kevin P. Ryan]] (Board Member) }} | location_city = {{plainlist| *New York City, USA *Palo Alto, California, USA *Dublin, Ireland *London, UK<ref name="10gen.com">http://www.10gen.com/contact</ref> *Sydney, Australia<ref name="10gen.com"/> }} | location_country = | industry = Software | homepage = {{URL|http://10gen.com/}} }}
'''10gen''' is a software company that develops and provides commercial support for the open source database [[MongoDB]], a [[NoSQL]] database that stores data in [[JSON]]-like documents with flexible schemas.
==History==
10gen was founded in 2007 by former [[DoubleClick]] founder and CTO [[Dwight Merriman]] and former DoubleClick CEO and [[Gilt Groupe]] founder [[Kevin P. Ryan]] with former Doubleclick engineer and [[ShopWiki]] founder and CTO [[Eliot Horowitz]]. 10gen has received $81 million in venture capital funding from [[Flybridge Capital Partners]], [[In-Q-Tel]], [[Intel]], [[New Enterprise Associates]] (NEA), [[Red Hat]], [[Sequoia Capital]], and [[Fred Wilson (financier)|Union Square Ventures]].<ref>[http://www.crainsnewyork.com/gallery/20130225/TECHNOLOGY/225009999/9 NYC's Largest Venture Capital Deals]</ref><ref>http://www.crunchbase.com/company/10gen</ref><ref>http://www.marketwatch.com/story/10gen-raises-42-million-financing-round-led-by-new-enterprise-associates-2012-05-29, WSJ, MarketWatch</ref><ref>http://gigaom.com/cloud/with-42m-more-10gen-wants-to-take-mongodb-mainstream/, GigaOm</ref>
The company originally aimed to build a [[platform as a service]] similar to [[Google App Engine]].<ref>http://www.theregister.co.uk/2011/05/25/the_once_and_future_mongodb/</ref> In 2009 the company decided to open source the database component, [[MongoDB]] as a stand-alone product.<ref name="release">[http://blog.mongodb.org/post/434865639/state-of-mongodb-march-2010 MongoDB Blog - March 2010]</ref>
The company currently has offices in New York, Palo Alto, Reston, London, Dublin, Barcelona and Sydney.<ref name="10gen.com"/><ref>[http://techcrunch.com/2011/09/12/sequoia-leads-20-million-round-in-mongodb-big-data-database-provider-10gen/ Sequoia Leads $20 Million Round In MongoDB Big Data Database Provider 10gen]</ref> 10gen was founded in New York City and opened its first west coast office in August 2010.<ref>[http://www.marketwire.com/press-release/10gen-Announces-Key-Hires-in-Engineering-and-Sales-1303938.htm 10gen Announces Key Hires in Engineering and Sales]</ref>
In September 2012, 10gen was named as the top software company and number 9 overall on [[The Wall Street Journal]]'s The Next Big Thing 2012.<ref>[http://online.wsj.com/article/SB10000872396390443328404578020963276320532.html The Next Big Thing 2012]</ref>
In April 2013, 10gen moved into the [[New York Times Building (41 Park Row)|old New York Times building]].<ref>[http://commercialobserver.com/2012/12/tech-firm-10gen-plants-a-flag-in-the-old-new-york-times-building/ Commercial Observer]</ref>
==Products and Services==
===MongoDB=== 10gen’s primary technology product is the open source, NoSQL database MongoDB. 10gen employs most of the developers of MongoDB.
===MongoDB Subscriptions=== In March 2010, 10gen announced that it would offer commercial support for MongoDB.<ref>[http://www.databasejournal.com/sqletc/article.php/3873406/Open-Source-MongoDB-Gets-Commercial-Support.htm Open Source MongoDB Gets Commercial Support]</ref> 10gen’s subscription offering includes access to MongoDB Enterprise, professional support, and commercial licensing.
===MongoDB Enterprise=== With MongoDB 2.4 release, 10gen introduced MongoDB Enterprise as part of its subscription offering.<ref>[http://www.eweek.com/database/10gens-mongodb-2.4-ships-adds-enterprise-features/ Eweek]</ref> MongoDB Enterprise contains monitoring and security features such as kerberos authentication and role-based privileges.
===MongoDB Monitoring Service=== In September 2011 the company announced the availability of MongoDB Monitoring Service (MMS), a free [[Software as a service|SaaS]] monitoring tool for MongoDB.<ref>[http://www.networkworld.com/community/blog/10gen-rolls-out-free-mongodb-monitoring-servi 10gen Rolls Out Free MongoDB Monitoring Service]</ref> An on-prem version of MMS is available to 10gen subscribers.
===MongoDB Backup Service=== 10gen announced the limited release of their hosted backup service in April 2013, enabling customers to backup and restore MongoDB clusters from the MMS UI.<ref>[http://gigaom.com/2013/04/30/10gen-introduces-a-backup-option-for-mongodb/ GigaOM]</ref><ref>[http://www.10gen.com/products/mongodb-backup-service MongoDB Backup Service]</ref>
===Online Education=== In September 2012, 10gen announced that they would be collaborating with [[EdX]] to offer free MongoDB training.<ref>[http://gigaom.com/2012/09/25/want-free-mongodb-classes-edx-and-10gen-are-happy-to-oblige/ Want free MongoDB classes? edX and 10gen are happy to oblige]</ref> There were 47,000 enrollments in the first MongoDB online education courses in 2012.<ref>[http://www.10gen.com/press/10gen-announces-2012-company-results] 10gen Announces Company Results</ref>
==References== {{Reflist|2}}
==External links== * {{Official website|http://www.10gen.com/}} * [http://www.mongodb.org/ MongoDB website] * [https://education.10gen.com/ 10gen Education] * [https://mms.10gen.com/user/login MongoDB Monitoring And Backup Service]
